intro: Vernonia oocephala, commonly known as the purpletop ironweed, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of small, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a slightly fuzzy appearance. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a hardy addition to native gardens. The genus Vernonia is part of the sunflower family, Asteraceae, and is known for its showy, composite flower heads.
